title: Weitsee
text:
Weitsee is a small <a href="lake">lake</a> on between <a href="Reit%20im%20Winkl">Reit im Winkl</a> and <a href="Ruhpolding">Ruhpolding</a> with an area of 63.60 ha and a maximum depth of 9.30 m. The lake itself is separated into a shallow western and a deeper eastern part by a mountain peninsula. It is the first lake in the Dreiseengebiet (Three Lake Area) followed by the <a href="Mittersee">Mittersee</a> and <a href="L%C3%B6densee">Lödensee</a>. The lakes are located in the valley between the <a href="Gurnwandkopf">Gurnwandkopf</a> und <a href="D%C3%BCrrnbachhorn">Dürrnbachhorn</a> next to the <a href="Deutsche%20Alpenstra%C3%9Fe">Deutsche Alpenstraße</a> B305 (German Alpine Street). 
Only a few small <a href="Tributary">tributaries</a> bring water to the lake; most of the water comes from a 5 m deep <a href="spring%20%28hydrosphere%29">spring</a> which is located at the narrowest part of the lake. All the water from the outflow of the lake ends in seepage at the end of the Lödensee after it has gone through Mittersee. Geological research showed that the water finds its way under the <a href="Hochgern">Hochgern</a> mountain to the <a href="bog">bog</a> near <a href="Bergen%2C%20Upper%20Bavaria">Bergen, Upper Bavaria</a>.
The lake with its <a href="beach">beach</a>, the clean water and the distance to the next village attract many people in summer. The beach has also a nudist part which is located farthest from the street. In the winter the <a href="cross-country%20ski">cross-country ski</a> run between <a href="Reit%20im%20Winkl">Reit im Winkl</a> and <a href="Ruhpolding">Ruhpolding</a> crosses the lake.
